thread.title: NWS confirms funnel cloud sighting in Coburg (video)
thread.title_full: NWS confirms funnel cloud sighting in Coburg (video) | OregonLive.com

author: Nuran Alteir | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: NWS confirms funnel cloud sighting in Coburg (video)
text:
An image showing a funnel cloud beyond the trees in Coburg is making the rounds on Twitter, and the National Weather Service in Portland has confirmed that it is indeed a funnel cloud.
The funnel cloud -- a narrow column of air akin to a tornado but which never touches the ground -- was spotted about 5 p.m. Friday, according to a tweet from KPTV.
Here is a video of a funnel cloud courtesy Patty Jenness and KVAL news. It was taken earlier this evening around 5pm...
Posted by US National Weather Service Portland Oregon on Monday, October 19, 2015 The cloud has since dissipated, said NWS meteorologist Colby Newman, and it is not clear if it ever touched the ground. The radar barely picked up the showers from which it was derived.
It's not unusual to see funnel clouds on a day like today, Newman said, adding it is unlikely Coburg residents will see any tornadoes Monday.
"It's not the kind of day where we see the strong tornadoes we've seen in the past," Newman said.
"If the public sees something like this in the future," however, "they should either take shelter or get somewhere that's safe. Being inside a car is generally not a good thing," Newman said.
Funnel cloud sighted at Coburg 5pm. Pic by Denny Heckert #pdxtst pic.twitter.com/WdTYj13uzq
— FOX 12 KPTV Weather (@fox12weather) October 20, 2015 In the Portland area, temperatures are expected to stay in the 60s with some rain toward the end of the week.
